metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1234 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Race condition in gpu/command_buffer/service/gles2_cmd_decoder.cc in GoogleChrome before 41.0.2272.118 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact bymanipulating OpenGL ES commands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqmlscene - 1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-codecs - 1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
